Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice with part of rather flat cul; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black (partly worn); exterior: reserved with streaky brown band at handle level; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: 'A923' and ' List 31' are written in pencil on the interior surface of the sherd. Painted inscription are found on Chian kantharoi and not chalices. This sherd has a cul, or certainly a carination, which is not a feature of kantharoi.
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 166, no. 47)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 719, no. 770)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1063) (phase 2)
